ygData.subject: Re: Lullaby tip
ygData.msgSnippet: No the Hymn works differently as I understand it The lullaby works alot more like bellow in a technical sense even though its continuous. Jaez ... From: Matt
ygData.messageBody:
No the Hymn works differently as I understand it
The lullaby works alot more like bellow in a technical sense even though its
continuous.

Jaez
-----Original Message-----
From: Matt Cristantello <cristant@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Sunday, July 18, 1999 11:48 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Lullaby tip


>From: Matt Cristantello <cristant@...>
>
>Does this strategy also work with the hymn of restoration? It makes sense
>that it would, and it could be useful for recovering from a particularly
bad
>fight.
>
>Kalduran
>The Rathe
>
>John Kim wrote:
>
>> From: John Kim <kim@...>
>>
>> You'll recall I did some song timings and came up with
>> 6 seconds between song pulses, and 3.5 seconds to start up a
>> song.
>>
>> If you leave Lullaby running, heads will nod once every
>> 6 seconds. If you immediately stop it and restart it when you
>> see the "nods" message, you can shorten this to 3.5-4 seconds.
>>
>> I tried doing it the latter way last night, and the rate that
>> it interrupted spellcasters went from about 50% to about 80%.
>> We even had several fights where the spellcasters didn't get a
>> single spell off because they nodded asleep before they could
>> finish casting.
>>
>> --
>> John H. Kim
>> kim@...
>>
>> --------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------
>>
>> Show your ONElist SPIRIT!
>> http://www.onelist.com
>> With a new ONElist SHIRT available through our website.
>>
>> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
>
